bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to A.V. McClain, March 21, 1941

div1.p: Hench writes that he is glad the autographed photographs of Moran and Kissinger have been found.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to A.V. McClain, March 21, 1941
div1.opener:
March 21, 1941
Mr. A. V. McClain
Assistant to the President
Washington and Jefferson College
Washington, Pennsylvania
My dear Mr. McClain:
div1.p:
I am much relieved and pleased to have the autographed
photographs of Mr. Moran and Mr. Kissinger turn up. I knew
darn well I had sent them and was sorry to think they were
“lost.” But “all's well that ends well.” I agree with you
that there is no need to disturb Mr. Brewer by further comments.
Heaven knows, I misplace things aften enough myself. I won't
write Hutch either but some day when he and I are both tight,
reeling stinke down the streets of Washington together, I'm
going to say to him, “Say, fellow, you remember when you thought
I was crazy and said you'd lost my photos? Well, let me tell you
- - - - - - .” And then the fun will begin. Meanwhile, I'm just
a bit caught up with you all for that special printing job!!
(or am I?).
div1.closer: Sincerely and gratefully yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:FP
